intro: Tithymalus berytheus, commonly known as the lesser tithymale, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters, often resembling those of other members of its family. The plant typically grows in moist, sandy soils and is found in temperate regions of Europe. It has slender stems and feathery, aromatic leaves that are often used in traditional herbal remedies. Due to its delicate nature, it is considered a rare and endangered species in many parts of its native habitat.
